title: Vernon and Woodbank Park Walking Route

images.title: Darren Haddock / Fred Perry Way
images.caption: Fred Perry Way. Entrance to Vernon Park and footpath

images.title: Gerald England / Sculpture in Vernon Park
images.caption: Sculpture in Vernon Park. In the background is Pear Mill

images.title: Alan Murray-Rust / Pear Mill, Stockport
images.caption: Pear Mill, Stockport. The Pear motif not only adorns the main tower, but also the corner turrets and many other locations. The name comes from a farm which occupied part of the site. Impressive as this building is, the original plan was for a 'double-fronted' mill, twice the size of what exists; the main tower would have been in the centre of the facade. The building is fully occupied and is in generally very good order.

images.title: Keith Williamson / River Goyt, Stockport
images.caption: River Goyt, Stockport. Here the River Goyt flows between Pear Mill, this square, and Vernon Park, in the adjacent square.

images.title: Gerald England / Vernon Park Fountain
images.caption: Vernon Park Fountain. Overnight frost was being melted by the sun and although some of the water in the pool was frozen, the fountain was flowing.

images.title: Gerald England / Vernon Park
images.caption: Looking from by the fountain pool towards New Bridge Lane.

images.title: Gerald England / Holly Tree in Vernon Park
images.caption: Holly Tree in the park

description: These two parks sit side by side near Stockport town centre. They have nice walking trails along the River Goyt, woodland trails, ponds with wildlife and well laid out gardens. From the high points in the park there are nice views towards the Peak District hills. The Midshires Way and the Etherow Goyt Valley Way both run through the park so you can pick these up to extend your walking in the area. Just to the north there's more nice trails around Reddish Vale Country Park, Haughton Dale Nature Reserve and Highfield Country Park .

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: For more walking ideas in the area see the Greater Manchester Walks page.
